abstract: A Boolean property indicating whether to reset history.
overview:
## Discussion

Set this property to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] to invalidate history, for example when there is a scene cut in your game.

When you set this property to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], you are responsible for ensuring the property [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTLFXFrameInterpolatorBase/prevColorTexture] contains frame data corresponding to that in [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTLFXFrameInterpolatorBase/colorTexture] during your previous call to [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTLFXFrameInterpolator/encode(commandBuffer:)].

# shouldResetHistory

**Instance Property**

A Boolean property indicating whether to reset history.

## Declaration

```swift
var shouldResetHistory: Bool { get set }
```

## Discussion

Set this property to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] to invalidate history, for example when there is a scene cut in your game.

When you set this property to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false], you are responsible for ensuring the property [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTLFXFrameInterpolatorBase/prevColorTexture] contains frame data corresponding to that in [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTLFXFrameInterpolatorBase/colorTexture] during your previous call to [doc://com.apple.metalfx/documentation/MetalFX/MTLFXFrameInterpolator/encode(commandBuffer:)].
title: shouldResetHistory
